casebody.data:
SANDHILL AMUSEMENTS, INC. and Gift Surplus, LLC
v.
Sheriff of Onslow County, North Carolina, Hans J. MILLER, in his official capacity; State of North Carolina, Governor Patrick Lloyd (Pat) McCrory, in his official capacity; Secretary of The North Carolina Department of Public Safety, Frank Perry, in his official capacity; Director of the North Carolina State Bureau of Investigation, Bernard W. (B.W.) Collier, II, in his official capacity; Director or Branch Head of the Alcohol Law Enforcement Branch of the State Bureau of Investigation, Mark J. Senter, in his official capacity No. 363A14-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 16, 2017 S. C. Kitchen, Attorney at Law, Chapel Hill, for Miller, Hans J. (in his official capacity). George B. Hyler, Jr., Attorney at Law, Asheville, Stephen P. Agan, Attorney at Law, for Gift Surplus, LLC. Michael A. Grace, Attorney at Law, Christopher R. Clifton, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, for Sandhill Amusements, Inc. Hal F. Askins, Special Deputy Attorney General, J. Joy Strickland, Assistant Attorney General, for Senter, Mark J. (Branch Head) (in his official capacity).

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 6th of December 2016 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Withdrawn by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th of March 2017."

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 6th of February 2017 by Defendant for Leave to Withdraw Petition for Discretionary Review:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th of March 2017."
